Bin Dawood DateCentre: Dates in abundance!
Helpfulness Muarrij 169 reviews The middle east is famous for its dates, especially Ajwa. These are in contrast very expensive to other dates.
There are many stores and outlets like the one in the picture that offer fresh or packed dates.
There are also many different varieties, you can even get stuffed dates, which come with a nut or other filling instead of the original stone/seed.
You can usually bargain with these guys. So make sure you get a good deal.
My preference however, is not to buy from the date factory, but instead buy from a store in one of the larger centres.
Favorite Dish: Ajwa Kajoor, (Date), is the one that was recommended by the Prophet, as it contains special healing powers.
As a result it is also one of the most sought after too! They are smaller, quite black and taste quite sweet.
* TIP * - Whilst you are in Makkah, why not buy some dates and distribute them to the locals and the those less fortunate to be able to buy their own. :)

A General Tip
Helpfulness Digi 94 reviews From what I saw, there wasn't a lot of indegenous food in Saudi Arabia. I could be wrong of course, but the majority of what was available was American food, and food from countries with large expat populations, notably Pakistani and Indian food.
For me, the American food was good on the stomach, as some of the Pakistani restaurants in Mecca were not in the best of shape. The American restaurants like BK, KFC and such cater to the Saudis, and as such are kept in pretty good shape.
In Mecca you can find anything in the large Hilton hotel right outside the grand Masjid.
